definition: return journey (e.g. home)
to return (to)
surname Cheng
rule/order/regulations/formula/journey/procedure/sequence

sentences.english: On the way back we stopped once more at the uncle's house in Kumjung.
sentences.chinese: 返程途中，我们又在昆坰那位大叔家稍事停留。

sentences.english: On your way back, you will pass Shanghai Qingpu Outlets, where you can do some shopping.
sentences.chinese: 返程途中经过上海青浦奥特莱斯，你可以去那里购物。

sentences.english: So you don't expect to return? I always set a return ticket.
sentences.chinese: 那你不打算回来了？我总是订一张返程票。

sentences.english: Would you like a single ticket or a return ticket?
sentences.chinese: 你想要单程票还是返程票？

sentences.english: On the way back our car was full of refugees.
sentences.chinese: 返程路上我们的车坐满了灾民。

sentences.english: Do you have a preference for your return flight?
sentences.chinese: 对于返程您更喜欢哪个时间？

sentences.english: Travel Agent: I see. Er, do you want the excursion fare or the full return fare.
sentences.chinese: 我知道了。请问你要单程票还是返程票？

sentences.english: Two retun tickets to London, please.
sentences.chinese: 买两张到伦敦的返程票。

sentences.english: The aircraft can take off on time.
sentences.chinese: 看来，飞机可以按时返程了。

definition: return trip
outbound trip
(of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for
to return to one's home town
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
journey/course of a journey/distance traveled/trajectory/itinerary/route/course (of history)/stroke (of a piston)/(Tw) (computing) process
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
scheduled flight/flight number/plane/scheduled sailing/sailing number/passenger ship
(increased) passenger transportation around Chinese New Year
to ride (in a vehicle)
to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
to set out on a journey
luggage/CL:件[jian4]
regular bus (service)
to take the car, bus, train etc
en route
